page.title: 01Middleton in Teesdale
page.content: Here the deep wooded valley of the Hudeshope Beck meets the wide rocky valley of the river Tees. The legacy of the leadmining era remains visible in todays landscape, but farming now forms the basis of the economy. Severe winters and thin poor soil limit this to grazing of sheep on the fells and rearing of cattle on lower slopes, with hay meadows and some dairy farming on the valley floor. Although a less well known tourist area tourism is important. The town offers field study centres, hotel, bed and breakfast and self catering facilities for visitors keen to walk, fish, shoot etc. in the picturesque dale. Walkers of the nearby Pennine Way call for provisions at the small friendly, owner run shops.
